answerText: William James[10] This man attacked the logical positivists in his "Two Dogmas of Empiricism," which questioned the distinction between analytic and synthetic truths as well as reductionism.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Brown University and Notre Dame | 10 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Identify these dudes who loved writing about empiricism, FTPE: [10] This man advocated the notion of a world of "pure experience" in his Essays in Radical Empiricism. He also authored The Will to Believe and Pragmatism.
